results.title: The Posidon Rush - Jack Flett
results.brief_description: In 1906 there was a brief gold rush to central Victoria following the discovery of the Poseidon Nuggets - the largest of which was 953 oz, on Melbourne Cup day. The rush was named for the winning horse that year. In this short interview Jack Flett recalls the schoolboy excitement of that time and of holding one of the famous nuggets.

results.title: The Portrait
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the tradition of portrait photography. Guest photographers Arnold Newman and Judy Dater, portrait photographers with contrasting approaches, describe practical techniques for using lighting, pose, mood, and environment to create memorable photographic portraits.

results.title: The Portrait
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
Aims to improve the viewers’ understanding of portrait photography as a creative medium and to increase their awareness of the visual options available to them as photographers. Several still photographers discuss their work.

results.title: The Portable power saw: how to use it safely
results.brief_description: An instructional film on how to use power saws both in industry and at home. Shows how to select the correct blades, how to fit them properly and the proper safety precautions.

results.title: The Pony
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and Lawrence Cherry
results.brief_description: In the hearts of two Saskatchewan farm children nothing could take the place of a pony. But their father’s eight hundred-hectare mechanized wheat farm seemed to have no place for one. How their wish was eventually fulfilled beyond expectation makes a heart-warming Christmas story. Cast includes Mary McNeil, George Russell, Helen Bothwell, William Cornish, Norman Ericson, Georgia Gibbs, Frank Hanson.

results.title: The Pond and the city
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Knickerbocker Productions, The Conservation Foundation and Wheaton Galentine
results.brief_description: Looks at the need for conservation of natural resources. Points out that water and forest resources are not inexhaustible, but must be carefully protected. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Pollution crisis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conserving Our Environment”.
As population increases, waste products are discarded in such increasing quantities that they cannot be absorbed by the environment, and pollution reaches crisis proportions. Shows some of the ways we are polluting our land, sea and air, and offers various solutions for protecting our environment.

results.title: The Politics of persuasion
results.creator_credit: Mark Zannis, ONF | NFB and Martin Defalco
results.brief_description: The story of how Torontonian John Bulloch turned a local tax protest movement into an efficient, media-wise, national lobbying organization that defends the interests of the small business community. Bulloch, the aggressive and articulate president and founder of the Canadian Federation of Independent Business (CFIB), understands the value of information and the techniques of power lobbying. This film shows how he and his 150-member CFIB staff acquired enough political savvy and clout to make legislators listen. The documentary also presents the views of those who are lobbied (with an explanation of power lobbying) and an analysis of the CFIB’s success.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Zannis, ONF | NFB and Martin Defalco

results.title: The Politician's love story
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: When a corrupt politician discovers that a satirical cartoon in the newspaper was created by a rather pretty young female cartoonist his anger soon turns into lust. Cast includes Mack Sennett, Kathlyn Williams, Marion Leonard, Florence Lawrence, D.W. Griffith. Silent film with no intertitles.
